result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

12:08 PM Defendant Timothy J Owen Sr in court.  Attorney Aaron R Anderson in court for Timothy J Owen Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for Plea hearing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  
Defense requests adjourned plea and sentencing date.
Bail remains as fixed pending sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on January 18, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:13 AM Defendant Timothy J Owen Sr in court.  Attorney Aaron R Anderson in court for Timothy J Owen Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests a date for a plea hearing.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Additional Discovery Demand, filed by Atty. Anderson

09:18 AM Defendant Timothy J Owen in court with attorney Aaron R Anderson.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver, filed by Atty. Anderson

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, filed by Atty. Perri
Signature Bond signed by Defendant, Timothy J. Owen Sr. on June 8, 2022.
Preliminary hearing on June 24, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Walmart or Target stores listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to have no contact with codefendant, Derek E Klemens.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to disclose all prescriptions to the District Attorney and Defense counsel.  All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy.

02:27 PM Defendant Timothy J Owen by Zoom (video) with attorney Aaron R Anderson as a Friend of the Court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court addresses Initial appearances in 22CF554 and 22CF736.
Attorney Anderson expects to be appointed to this matter.
Defense acknowledges receipt of the Criminal Complaint and waives further reading.
Defense requests preliminary hearing and waives  time limits.
Court sets signature bond.
Defendant to sign signature bond by end of day on 6/13/22.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Initial appearance on June 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

09:10 AM  Defendant Timothy J Owen appeared by Zoom with attorney Aaron R Anderson who appeared by Zoom.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court is inclined to adjourn the matter for the Defendant to appear in person.
The State does not object.
The Court will adjourn.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
